intro: Chromatotriccum cylindricum, commonly known as the spiral liverwort, is a small, aquatic or semi-aquatic liverwort belonging to the family Marchaliaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive spiral arrangement of thallus lobes, which gives it a unique and intricate appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks, wetlands, and rocky areas. Its thallus is usually green or reddish in color, depending on the light conditions and nutrient availability. Chromatotriccum cylindricum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for microorganisms and contributing to nutrient cycling.
